title: Zeromq
description: Schema describing the JSON file structure for the zeromq configuration.

port.description: Port to which the broker binds the socket

internalServicePrefix.description: Internal Service Prefix for Majordomo Message Interface

heartbeatLiveness.description: Heartbeat liveness, a value between 3-5 is usually okay

heartbeatInterval.description: Time interval between each heartbeat, in milliseconds

heartbeatExpiry.description: Expiry time for a heartbeat, usually heartbeatInterval * heartbeatLiveness

adhocTransmissionModel.title: adhocTransmissionModel
adhocTransmissionModel.description: Object to define an adhoc transmission model.

type.description: Type of the transmission model. The simple model assumes, that all receivers can be reached even though this might not be the case in reality.

simpleMultihopDelay.description: Delay to be used for a simple multihop.

simpleMultihopTransmission.description: Transmission parameters to be used for a simple multihop.

delay.title: delay
delay.description: Object to define a delay model.

gammaDelay.title: gammaDelay
gammaDelay.description: Object to define a model for GammaRandomDelay or GammaSpeedDelay. GammaRandomDelay bases directly on the Gamma distribution (b=2,p=2) with minimum and expected value. Due to the nature of the Gamma distribution, the resulting delays can be far higher than the expected value. GammaSpeedDelay bases on the GammaRandomDelay and includes an additional speed penalty according to the current speed of the vehicle.

minDelay.description: Minimum delay for the Gamma distribution. If defined as a number, then the default unit is ns. Alternatively this can be defined as a string to include the unit of measurement (e.g. '3 seconds')

expDelay.description: Expected delay for the Gamma distribution. If defined as a number, then the default unit is ns. Alternatively this can be defined as a string to include the unit of measurement (e.g. '3 seconds')

constantDelay.title: constantDelay
constantDelay.description: Object to define a model for constant delay, which delivers always the same delay.

delay.description: The delay. If defined as a number, then the default unit is ns. Alternatively this can be defined as a string to include the unit of measurement (e.g. '3 seconds')

simpleRandomDelay.title: simpleRandomDelay
simpleRandomDelay.description: Object to define a model for a radnomised delay. Delivers number-of-steps different uniformly distributed delays in the interval defined by min and max (e.g. minDelay=30ms, maxDelay=60ms, steps=4 -> possible delays={30,40,50,60}ms.).

steps.description: Number of possible delays between min and max.

minDelay.description: Minimum delay in nanoseconds for the Gamma distribution. If defined as a number, then the default unit is ns. Alternatively this can be defined as a string to include the unit of measurement (e.g. '3 seconds')

maxDelay.description: Maximum delay in nanoseconds for the Gamma distribution. If defined as a number, then the default unit is ns. Alternatively this can be defined as a string to include the unit of measurement (e.g. '3 seconds')

transmission.title: tranmission
transmission.description: Object to define the properties of a transmission.

lossProbability.description: Probability of packet retransmission (in case of configured retries > 0) or packet loss (retries = 0) for the packet retransmission/loss model. A value of 0 equals a lossfree transmission.
